titles.title: National Security and Classified Information Protection Act of 1993
To amend title 18, United States Code, to make the knowing disclosure of classified information by Federal officers and employees a criminal offense.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Crime and Criminal Justice.

bill.summary: 1/5/1993--Introduced. National Security and Classified Information Protection Act of 1993 - Amends the Federal criminal code to make the knowing disclosure of classified information to an unauthorized person by present and former Federal officials and employees a criminal offense.
